definition: lit. the divine steed Feihuang gallops (idiom)/fig. to achieve meteoric success in one's career
to fly
surname Huang or Hwang
yellow/pornographic/to fall through
to soar/to gallop/to prance/to turn over/to vacate/to clear
surname Da
to attain/to reach/to amount to/to communicate/eminent

sentences.english: The Johnsons have come up in the world.
sentences.chinese: 约翰一家已飞黄腾达起来了。

sentences.english: Too many fellows think they can push themselves forward by patting themselves on the back.
sentences.chinese: 很多人以为自吹自捧，就可以飞黄腾达。

sentences.english: In brief, Lydgate was what is called a successful man.
sentences.chinese: 总之，利德盖特是我们所说的飞黄腾达的人。

sentences.english: Also said that after his the apprentice, will return LuoFeng.
sentences.chinese: 还说以后自己飞黄腾达了，会报答罗丰。

definition: to rapidly go up in the world/meteoric rise (of a career, social position etc)
rising straight up in a clear sky (idiom); rapid promotion to a high post/meteoric career
(of a political career) everything is going smoothly (idiom)
to be promoted and gain wealth (idiom)
to climb step by step/to rise steadily/on the up and up
riches and honor
splendor shines on the family's door (idiom)/fig. to bring honor to one's family
to win success and recognition (idiom)
to bring honor to one's ancestors
glory, splendor, wealth and rank (idiom); high position and great wealth
promotion to the nobility (idiom)
the time comes, fortune turns (idiom); to have a lucky break/things change for the better
lit. ten thousand strings of cash in money belt (idiom); carrying lots of money/extremely wealthy/loaded
both fame and fortune (idiom)/both virtue and reward
very rich/millionaire
to stand out among one's peers (idiom)/to excel
